Class ConnectFour

  • java.lang.Object
    • ConnectFour

  • public class ConnectFour
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class ConnectFour is the main game class that holds information about running games. New games are greated and managed here. Events of the game are given to a GameListener (The gui in this case).

        public void newGame(int toWin,
           int rows,
           int cols,
           java.util.List<Player> players)
        Start a new game with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        toWin - Number of tokens in a row required to win.
        rows - Number of rows on the board.
        cols - Number of columns on the board.
        players - List of players in the game.

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Method to check if the game is over.
        Returns:
        true if there are tokensToWin connected same-colour tokens or if the game is drawn false otherwise

      • checkValidTokenSeries

        private int checkValidTokenSeries(Player player,
                        int column,
                        int row,
                        int dCol,
                        int dRow)
        Finds the number of adjacent tokens owned by the given player, where the next checked token is at column: current column + dCol and row: current row + dRow.
        Parameters:
        player - The Player whose tokens will be counted as valid.
        column - The starting column.
        row - The starting row.
        dCol - The value to change the current column by to get the next space.
        dRow - The value to change the current row by to get the next space.
        Returns:
        The number of adjacent player's tokens in the given direction.

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public Player getCurrentPlayer()
        Method to get the current player.
        Returns:
        the player for the current turn.

        public void undo()
        Method to undo a move.
